workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Sample that demonstrates the use of workflow steps in the zTrial program.

variable.name: dataSetName
variable.label: Data set name
variable.abstract: The name of a z/OS data set that is going to be used.
variable.description: The data set (dataSetName) to be used for saving the generated JCL.

step.name: discoverystep
step.title: Discover z/OS features in use
step.description: In this step, you execute a JCL job to check which z/OS priced features are currently enabled on your system.
step.instructions: This step of the workflow will determine which z/OS priced features are currently enabled on the running system.

step.name: createDS
step.title: Create a data set
step.description: In this step, you define the data set name, and use the name to create a data set via the z/OS data REST interface.
step.instructions:
In this example step, you can create a data set via the z/OS data REST interface.
You use predefined settings as request body, if the status code of the response is 201, it means the data set ${instance-dataSetName} is created successfully.

step.name: saveDSContent
step.title: Submit a JCL job and save the content in the data set
step.description: This step involves submitting a JCL job.
step.instructions:
In this example step, you submit a JCL job.
You will have the option to save a copy of the JCL in the data set ${instance-dataSetName} after you have reviewed it for your approval.

template.inlineTemplate:
//IZUWFJOB JOB /* rexx */
TM = TIME('S') I = TM DO WHILE I < (TM + 5) I = TIME('S') END SAY 'Welcome to z/OSMF Workflows.'

step.name: getDSContent
step.title: Retrieve the contents of the z/OS data set
step.description: In this step, you retrieve the contents of a data set via the z/OS data REST interface.
step.instructions:
In this example step, you can retrieve the contents of the data set ${instance-dataSetName} via the z/OS data REST interface.
If the status code of the response is 200, it means you get the contents of the data set ${instance-dataSetName} successfully.

step.name: deleteDS
step.title: Delete the data set
step.description: In this step, you delete the data set via the z/OS data REST interface.
step.instructions:
In this example step, you can delete the data set ${instance-dataSetName} via the z/OS data REST interface.
If the status code of the response is 204, it means you delete the data set ${instance-dataSetName} successfully.
